intro: Periloba baccata, commonly known as the red-fruited nightshade, is a flowering plant native to parts of Central and South America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and peppers. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale purple in color. Its fruit is a bright red berry that contains several seeds. Due to its toxic properties, it is not suitable for consumption by humans or animals.
